file_content.text: The job's done.
Excellent news, but it's only our first step.
One of the Nova Blades mentioned a slave camp. Somewhere remote. We should strike there next.
I have a suggestion.
Good call, actually. I ran across some chatter about that place.
Someone called Margok is in charge of the Nova Blades. He'll get us closer to the Revanites.
Let's go after Margok.
Yes, he will--but he's safely inside his headquarters. We must set his operations into a state of disarray, send his forces scattering.
Did you have something in mind?
What's next?
I intercepted some chatter about a slave camp--well, more like a slave island.
I heard one of their lieutenants mention it.
Basically, anyone in Raider's Cove who doesn't give the Nova Blades a slice of their action or whatever gets locked away.
Some get put into hazardous labor--like mining--but most are sold as slaves to visitors from offworld. It's a lucrative business for the Blades.
Not anymore.
You mean "was" lucrative.
You got that right.
Give me the coordinates and I'll get started.
Where is the camp?
It's not that simple; we don't actually know where the slave island is.
So, just like their supply cache, if I destroy the assets they're left with nothing.
Can't sell a dead slave.
Whoa--if you're suggesting what I think you are...!
As you said yourself, these slaves are assets. They're also enemies of the Nova Blades, which makes them all the more valuable to us alive.
You'll have to slip in with one of the Nova Blades' cargo shipments. I'm sure the island's heavily guarded, so try not to get killed.
I believe Theron means to say he's concerned for your safety--as am I. May the Force serve you well.
Theron, do you read me? The supply cache has been destroyed.
Theron? Our task is complete.
Havoc to base. Objective complete.
Hey there. I don't know if you guys have heard, but the Red Hulls just completely trashed a Nova Blade supply cache.
I understand the main suspect is being described as "skilled and extremely attractive."
Nice work.
I believe one more assault on the Nova Blades' holdings should be enough to solidify our "pirate feud" and disguise our true goal.
One of the Blades mentioned a slave camp. Do you know anything about it?
We do. You remember me saying that the Nova Blades basically run things around here? For the most part, they're pretty hands-off.
But if someone stands up to them, or fails to pay their "fees" to live here? The Blades grab them and ship them off to the slave camp.
The slaves are a substantial part of the Nova Blades' income, both through their labor in hazardous mines and as merchandise for offworld slave traders.
According to our information, the slaves are kept on a remote island under heavy guard. Do you think you can manage to free them?
No one should have to suffer in slavery. I'll take care of it.
It would be my pleasure.
You really aren't like other Sith, are you?
[Flirt] An interesting suggestion.
I like to think I'm my own woman.
Is this some kind of trick?
Sith do not free slaves. They kill them, or capture them for their own use. What's your game here, Lana?
You're joking. A Sith who wants to free slaves? You expect me to believe that?
This is not some kind of elaborate deception. Freeing them contributes to our goals. It's that simple.
Since we don't know the island's exact coordinates, your best bet is to stow away in one of the shipping containers the Nova Blades take out there.
Once you reach the slave camp, you can catch them by surprise, break up the security, and free as many as possible.
All in a day's work for a noble Jedi, yes?
Just another day for the hero of Havoc Squad, yes?
Certainly nothing a daring star pilot can't handle, yes?
